intro: Drymoglossum brooksii, commonly known as the Brooks' moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. The plant has a dense, compact structure with closely packed leaves that are usually green to reddish in color. It lacks true stems and roots, instead relying on rhizoids for anchorage and nutrient absorption. Drymoglossum brooksii is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to survive in humid, low-light conditions.
